snippet: The pledge of Grover Norquist may have been a useful campaign tool, but it is powerless to prevent automatic tax increases and failed to restrain past spending.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Sen Tom Coburn rejects notion that Republican lawmakers are thralls to antitax lobbyist Grover G Norquist, contending that they have repeatedly rejected his strict interpretation of the no-new-taxes pledge; contends that Norquist's uncompromising views about taxation have caused him to become isolated, and that Democrats should stop using him as a political boogeyman
lead_paragraph: The pledge of Grover Norquist may have been a useful campaign tool, but it is powerless to prevent automatic tax increases and failed to restrain past spending.
